metadata.title: CVE-2024-43849 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:soc: qcom: pdr: protect locator_addr with the main mutexIf the service locator server is restarted fast enough, the PDR canrewrite locator_addr fields concurrently. Protect them by placingmodification of those fields under the main pdr->lock.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43849` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
